name: Chloe Zhang
about: a crochet🧶 enthusiast who also happens to weave captivating code. With a Computer Science degree from UBC, I've merged my love for crocheting with crafting digital magic. From turning intricate crochet patterns into adorable real-life stuffies🧸 to blending creativity and technology, I'm all about the art of detail. Join me as I spin both digital and tangible yarns, creating a world where crafts and code collide!

experiences.title: Software Developer Co-op
descriptions: Contributed to the front-end migration, modernizing .Net ASPX to Angular for an improved user experience, leveraging the company’s design system’s components and utilities.
Implemented end-to-end Integration testing using Selenium, reduced manual regression effort and gaining in-depth codebase insights.
Developed a comprehensive understanding of backend technologies, including .NET and Oracle SQL.
Extracted and refactored reusable business logic into RESTful API endpoints, ensuring seamless front-end integration.
Proactively addressed user experience improvement tickets and bugs, promptly resolving issues for enhanced usability and accessibility.

experiences.title: Cloud Developer Co-op
descriptions: Participated in the implementation of a web-based Medical Case Sharing Platform, hosted on GCP Cloud Run, enabling the creation, sharing, viewing and comparison of various medical cases.
Developed a seamless case categorization UI using React and Redux with infinite scroll pagination functionality.
Designed and implemented a recursive search functionality, enabling users to efficiently navigate and locate case files within a structured UI folder hierarchy.
Collaborated on the design of relational database table schema, and implemented RESTful APIs through Node.JS, facilitating CRUD operations on Google Cloud Spanner.
Wrote comprehensive Jest Unit tests to enhance code quality and ensure robustness across the application.

experiences.title: Teaching Assistant
descriptions: Assisted 150 students in CPSC 455 Applied Industry Practices, a project-based course focusing on web development from React, Express, MongoDB to deployment.
Delivered a Git workflow mini-lecture, introducing version control and collaborative development processes
Supported students in bi-weekly office hours, aiding coding challenges and production-ready solutions.
Hosted design review sessions for 5 groups, fostering innovation and problem-solving in software development.
